intro: Thrixspermum inquinatum, commonly known as the sooty thrixspermum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
